Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an HTTP/2 server using Netty framework, supporting SSL/TLS encryption and providing methods for server startup and shutdown.

Class Description: BaseHttp2Server is an abstract class that serves as a foundation for building HTTP/2 servers using Netty. It handles SSL/TLS configuration, channel management, and provides basic server lifecycle methods. Concrete implementations must define their own request handlers.

Attributes:
- sslContext: [SslContext] - SSL/TLS context for secure connections
- hasReleasedSslContext: [AtomicBoolean] - Tracks whether SSL context resources have been released
- bootstrap: [ServerBootstrap] - Netty server bootstrap configuration
- shouldShutDownEventLoopGroup: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether to shutdown event loop group
- allChannels: [ChannelGroup] - Tracks all active server channels

Methods:
- BaseHttp2Server([SslContext], [EventLoopGroup]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the server with SSL context and optional event loop group
- addHandlersToPipeline([SSLSession], [ChannelPipeline]) -> [void] - Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses for adding custom handlers to the pipeline
- start([int]) -> [CompletableFuture<Integer>] - Starts the server on specified port and returns future with bound port number
- shutdown() -> [CompletableFuture<Void>] - Gracefully shuts down the server and releases resources
